name: ebpf.io
description: A gateway to discover all the basics of eBPF, including a listing of the main related projects and of community resources.

name: Cilium's BPF and XDP Reference Guide
description: In-depth documentation about most features and aspects of eBPF.

name: BPF Documentation
description: Index for BPF-related documentation coming with the Linux kernel.

name: linux/Documentation/networking/filter.rst
description: eBPF specification (somewhat outdated; information should still be valid, but not exhaustive).

name: BPF Design Q&A
description: Frequently Asked Questions on the decisions behind the BPF infrastructure.

name: HOWTO interact with BPF subsystem
description: Frequently Asked Questions about contributing to eBPF development.

name: bpf(2)
description: Manual page about the bpf() system call, used to manage BPF programs and maps from userspace.

name: tc-bpf(8)
description: Manual page about using BPF with tc, including example commands and samples of code.

name: bpf-helpers(7) man page
description: Description of the in-kernel helper functions forming the BPF standard library.

name: IO Visor's Unofficial eBPF spec
description: Summary of eBPF syntax and operation codes.

name: Jesper Dangaard Brouer's documentation
description: Work in progress, contributions welcome.

name: List of BPF features per kernel version
A brief introduction to XDP and eBPF
description: An accessible introduction providing context, history, and details about the functioning of eBPF.

name: Part 1: Introduction
description: Blog series by Adrian Ratiu, covering many aspects of the eBPF infrastructure:

name: Ferris Ellis's blog posts about eBPF
description: They have a few posts about eBPF:

name: A BPF reference guide
description: About BPF C and bcc Python helpers, from bcc repository.

name: Making the Kernel's Networking Data Path Programmable with BPF and XDP
description: A set of slides covering all the basics about eBPF and XDP (mostly for network processing).

name: The BSD Packet Filter
description: An introduction mostly covering the tracing aspects.

name: BPF: tracing and more
description: An introduction mostly covering the tracing aspects.

name: Linux BPF Superpowers
description: An introduction mostly covering the tracing aspects, first part with flame graphs.

name: IO Visor
description: Also introduces IO Visor project.

name: BPF -- in-kernel virtual machine
description: Presentation by the author of eBPF.

name: Extending extended BPF
description: A blog post from 2014 on the development of BPF and demonstrating what can be done with it, using an example of stateful socket filtering by attaching an eBPF program to a socket.

name: A Tour of Program Types
description: A description of all existing hooks for BPF program types, and of their interest.

name: A Tour of Program Types
description: A description of all existing hooks for BPF program types, and of their interest.

name: BPF helper functions
description: A review of the kernel functions that can be called from within eBPF programs.

name: Communicating with Userspace
description: How BPF communicates with userspace - BPF maps, perf events, bpf_trace_printk.

name: Building BPF Programs
description: Setting up your environment to build BPF programs.

name: The BPF Bytecode and the BPF Verifier
description: How does BPF ensure that programs are safe?

name: Using BPF to do Packet Transformation
description: One eBPF usage about packet transformation.

name: Linux Kernel Observability through eBPF
description: A blog post covering the basics of eBPF as well as code samples in Go on how to build and load a minimal eBPF program into the kernel.

name: eBPF - From a Programmer's Perspective
description: From a Programmer's Perspective - A short paper describing the fundamentals of eBPF and how to get started with writing eBPF programs.

name: Cloudflare's blog posts on eBPF
description: Different blog posts about networking use cases and low-level aspects of eBPF.

name: Linux Extended BPF (eBPF) Tracing Tools
description: An in-depth collection of information around examples of performance analysis tools using eBPF. Contains also a section at the end of the page about other resources.

name: Beginner's guide to eBPF
description: A set of live-coding talks and the accompanying code examples, introducing eBPF programming using a variety of libraries and program types.

name: eBPF and XDP walkthrough and recent (2017) updates
description: Details on eBPF, its use for tunneling and encapsulation, direct packet access, and more.

name: eBPF and XDP walkthrough and recent (2017) updates
Advanced programmability and recent updates with tc's cls_bpf
description: Details on eBPF, its use for tunneling and encapsulation, direct packet access, and more.

name: cls_bpf/eBPF updates since netdev 1.1
description: Part of this tc workshop.

name: On getting tc classifier fully programmable with cls_bpf
description: Introduction to eBPF, including several features (map management, tail calls, verifier). The full paper is also available here.

name: Linux Networking Explained
description: Linux networking internals, with a part about eBPF.

name: Full-system dynamic tracing on Linux using eBPF and bpftrace
description: A detailed introduction to tracing with eBPF, from listing the available trace points to running bpftrace programs.

name: Meet-cute between eBPF and Kernel Tracing
description: Kprobes, uprobes, ftrace.

name: Linux Kernel Tracing
description: Systemtap, Kernelshark, trace-cmd, LTTng, perf-tool, ftrace, hist-trigger, perf, function tracer, tracepoint, kprobe/uprobe, and more.

name: The eXpress Data Path
description: A very accessible introduction to XDP, providing sample code to show how to process packets.

name: The eXpress Data Path: Fast Programmable Packet Processing in the Operating System Kernel
BPF and XDP Reference Guide
description: Guide from the Cilium project.

name: eXpress Data Path (XDP)
description: The first presentation about XDP.

name: BoF - What Can BPF Do For You?
description: What Can BPF Do For You?

name: eXpress Data Path
description: Contains some benchmark results obtained with the mlx4 driver.

name: XDP − eXpress Data Path, Intro and future use-cases
description: Linux Kernel's fight against DPDK. Future plans (as of this writing) for XDP and comparison with DPDK.

name: XDP − eXpress Data Path, Intro and future use-cases
description: Linux Kernel's fight against DPDK. Future plans (as of this writing) for XDP and comparison with DPDK.

name: Network Performance Workshop
description: Additional hints about XDP internals and expected evolution.

name: XDP – eXpress Data Path, Used for DDoS protection
description: Details and use cases about XDP, with benchmark results, and code snippets for benchmarking as well as for basic DDoS protection with eBPF/XDP (based on an IP blacklisting scheme).

name: Memory vs. Networking, Provoking and fixing memory bottlenecks
description: Advanced details about current memory issues faced by XDP developers.

name: XDP for the Rest of Us
description: How to get started with eBPF and XDP for normal humans. Also summarized by Julia Evans on her blog.

name: XDP now with REDIRECT
description: Update on XDP, and in particular on the redirect actions.

name: XDP workshop -- Introduction, experience, and future development (Video)
High Speed Packet Filtering on Linux
description: About packet filtering on Linux, DDoS protection, packet processing in the kernel, kernel bypass, XDP and eBPF.

name: How to drop 10 million packets per second
description: Cloudflare's blog post talking about their move to using XDP for packet filtering.

name: AF_XDP
description: Kernel documentation on the AF_XDP address family.

name: Fast Packet Processing in Linux with AF_XDP
Why is the kernel community replacing iptables with BPF?
description: A blog post by Cilium on the the motivations behind eBPF and bpfilter, with a couple examples and links to other projects using eBPF and bpfilter.

name: bpfilter: Linux firewall with eBPF sauce
description: Slides from a talk by Quentin Monnet with a background on eBPF and comparing bpfilter to iptables.

name: BPF Type Format (BTF)
description: Kernel documentation about BTF, explaining how to use it.

name: Enhancing the Linux kernel with BTF type information
description: A description of the work done with BTF to provide debugging information for BPF programs.

name: The BSD Packet Filter: A New Architecture for User-level Packet Capture
description: The original paper about (classic) BPF.

name: The FreeBSD manual page about BPF
Linux' packet mmap(2), BPF, and Netsniff-NG
tc and cls bpf: lightweight packet classifying with BPF
Introducing Cloudflare's BPF Tools
description: Usage of BPF bytecode with the xt_bpf module for iptables.

name: eBPF/XDP hardware offload to SmartNICs
description: Hardware offload for eBPF with TC or XDP (Linux kernel 4.9+), introduced by Netronome.

name: Comprehensive XDP offload---Handling the edge cases
description: An update on the topic above.

name: hBPF - eBPF in hardware
description: eBPF in hardware - An eBPF CPU written for FPGAs.

name: OpenCSD eBPF SSD offloading
description: Computational Storage simulation (QEMU) platform with FUSE LFS filesystem for Zoned Namespaces NVMe SSDs using uBPF for compute kernel offloading, all in userspace.

name: bcc Reference Guide
description: Many incremental steps to start using bcc and eBPF, mostly centered on tracing and monitoring.

name: bcc Python Developer Tutorial
description: Comes with bcc, but targets the Python bits across seventeen "lessons".

name: Building BPF applications with libbpf-bootstrap
description: Helps generate minimal or advanced templates to bootstrap your own applications (kernel side and user space management for maps and programs) with features like CO-RE, global variables, and ring buffer.

name: How I ended up writing opensnoop in pure C using eBPF
description: A thorough walk-through of how to write eBPF programs, first using only bpf() syscall, and then libbpf library, with reproducible code examples.

name: Linux Tracing Workshops Materials
description: Involves the use of several BPF tools for tracing.

name: Tracing a packet journey using Linux tracepoints, perf and eBPF
description: Troubleshooting ping requests and replies with perf and bcc programs.

name: Open NFP platform
description: Operated by Netronome: some tutorials for network-related eBPF use cases, including an eBPF Offload Starting Guide.

name: XDP for the Rest of Us
description: First edition of a workshop to get started with XDP.

name: XDP for the Rest of Us
description: Second edition, with new contents.

name: Load XDP programs using the ip (iproute2) command
XDP Hands-On Tutorial
description: A progressive (three levels of difficulty) tutorial to learn how to process packets with XDP.

name: All your tracing are belong to BPF
description: A step-by-step walkthrough to integrate tracing capabilities in your C++ applications with the LLVM libraries.

name: Firewalling with BPF/XDP: Examples and Deep Dive
description: A simple guide to build basic firewalls with TC and XDP.

name: A Deep Dive into eBPF: Writing an Efficient DNS Monitoring.
description: A detailed explanation of methods used to capture DNS requests at the socket filter layer.

name: linux/samples/bpf/
description: In the kernel tree: some sample eBPF programs.

name: linux/tools/testing/selftests/bpf
description: In the kernel tree: Linux BPF selftests, with many eBPF programs.

name: prototype-kernel/kernel/samples/bpf
description: Jesper Dangaard Brouer's prototype-kernel repository contains some additional examples that can be compiled outside of kernel infrastructure.

name: iproute2/examples/bpf/
description: Some networking programs to attach to the TC interface.

name: Netronome sample network applications
description: Provides basic but complete examples of eBPF applications also compatible with hardware offload.

name: bcc/examples
description: Examples coming along with the bcc tools, mostly about tracing.

name: bcc/tools
description: These tools themselves can be seen as example use cases for BPF programs, mostly for tracing and monitoring. bcc tools have been packaged for some Linux distributions.

name: MPLSinIP sample
description: A heavily commented sample demonstrating how to encapsulate & decapsulate MPLS within IP. The code is commented for those new to BPF development.

name: ebpf-samples
description: A collection of compiled (as ELF object files) samples gathered from several projects, primarily intended to serve as test cases for user space verifiers.

name: ebpf-kill-example
description: A fully documented and tested example of an eBPF probe that logs all force-kills and prints them out in user-space.

name: redbpf examples
description: Example programs for using RedBPF to write eBPF programs in Rust.

name: bcc
description: Framework and set of tools - One way to handle BPF programs, in particular for tracing and monitoring. Also includes some utilities that may help inspect maps or programs on the system.

name: Lua front-end for BCC
description: Another alternative to C, and even to most of the Python code used in bcc.

name: iproute2
description: Package containing tools for network management on Linux. In particular, it contains tc, used to manage eBPF filters and actions, and ip, used to manage XDP programs. Most of the code related to BPF is in lib/bpf.c.

name: iproute2-next
description: The development tree, synchronised with net-next.

name: LLVM
description: Contains several tools used in eBPF workflows. Snapshots of the latest versions for Ubuntu/Debian can be retrieved from here.

name: libbpf
description: A C library used for handling BPF objects (programs and maps), and manipulating ELF object files containing them. It is shipped with the kernel and mirrored on GitHub.

name: libbpf-bootstrap
description: Scaffolding for BPF application development with libbpf and BPF CO-RE.

name: cilium/ebpf
description: Pure-Go library to read, modify and load eBPF programs and attach them to various hooks in the Linux kernel.

name: libbpfgo
description: eBPF library for Go, powered by libbpf.

name: gobpf
description: Go bindings for BCC for creating eBPF programs.

name: aya
description: A pure Rust library for writing, loading, and managing eBPF objects, with a focus on developer experience and operability. It supports writing eBPF programs in Rust and distributing library code over crates.io to share it between eBPF programs. Aya does not depend on libbpf.

name: aya-template
description: Templates for writing BPF applications in Aya that can be used with cargo generate.

name: zbpf
description: A pure Zig framework for writing cross platform eBPF programs, powered by libbpf and Zig toolchain.

name: eunomia-bpf
description: A compilation framework and runtime library to build, distribute, dynamically load, and run CO-RE eBPF applications in multiple languages and WebAssembly. It supports writing eBPF kernel code only (to build simple CO-RE libbpf eBPF applications), writing the kernel part in both BCC and libbpf styles, and writing userspace in multiple languages in a WASM module and distributing it with simple JSON data or WASM OCI images. The runtime is based on libbpf only and provides CO-RE to BCC-style eBPF programs without depending on the LLVM library.

name: oxidebpf
description: A pure Rust library for managing eBPF programs, designed for security use cases. The featureset is more limited than other libraries but emphasizes stability across a wide range of kernels and backwards-compatible compile-once-run-most-places.

name: bpftool
description: Also some other tools in the kernel tree, under linux/tools/net/ for versions earlier than 4.15, or linux/tools/bpf/ after that:

name: bpftool
description: A generic utility that can be used to interact with eBPF programs and maps from userspace, for example to show, dump, load, disassemble, pin programs, or to show, create, pin, update, delete maps, or to attach and detach programs to cgroups.

name: bpf_asm
description: A minimal cBPF assembler.

name: bpf_dbg
description: A small debugger for cBPF programs.

name: bpf_jit_disasm
description: A disassembler for both BPF flavors and could be highly useful for JIT debugging.

name: uBPF
description: Written in C. Contains an interpreter, a JIT compiler for x86_64 architecture, an assembler and a disassembler.

name: A generic implementation
description: With support for FreeBSD kernel, FreeBSD user space, Linux kernel, Linux user space and macOS user space. Used for the VALE software switch's BPF extension module.

name: rbpf
description: Written in Rust. Interpreter for Linux, macOS and Windows, and JIT-compiler for x86_64 under Linux.

name: PREVAIL
description: A user space verifier for eBPF using an abstract interpretation layer, with support for loops.

name: oster
description: Written in Go. A tool for tracing execution of Go programs by attaching eBPF to uprobes.

name: wachy
description: A tracing profiler that aims to make eBPF uprobe-based debugging easier to use. This is done by displaying traces in a UI next to the source code and allowing interactive drilldown analysis.

name: eBPF for Windows
description: This project is a work-in-progress that allows using existing eBPF toolchains and APIs familiar in the Linux ecosystem to be used on top of Windows.

name: A Vagrant setup
description: To easily test XDP. Less useful now that generic XDP (driver-independant, mostly for testing) exists.

name: P4 on the Edge
description: P4 with eBPF to create high-performance programmable switches.

name: P4 on the Edge
description: P4 with eBPF to create high-performance programmable switches.

name: OvS Orbit episode (#11), called P4 on the Edge
description: Related to the former item. Audio interview of John Fastabend by Ben Pfaff, one of the core maintainers of Open vSwitch.

name: P4, EBPF and Linux TC Offload
description: P4 with some elements related to eBPF hardware offload on Netronome's NFP (Network Flow Processor) architecture.

name: Old documentation for P4 usage with eBPF
description: From bcc repository; deprecated by the P4_16 backend linked below.

name: Cilium
description: Also featuring a load balancer use case

name: Cilium: Networking & Security for Containers with BPF & XDP
description: Also featuring a load balancer use case

name: Cilium: Networking & Security for Containers with BPF & XDP
description: video

name: Cilium: Fast IPv6 container Networking with BPF and XDP
OvS Orbit episode (#4)
description: Interview of Thomas Graf by Ben Pfaff.

name: A podcast interviewing Thomas Graf
description: Ivan Pepelnjak interviewing Thomas, October 2016, on eBPF, P4, XDP and Cilium.

name: Offloading OVS Flow Processing using eBPF
Offloading OVS Flow Processing using eBPF
Coupling the Flexibility of OVN with the Efficiency of IOVisor
Katran
description: A layer 4 load-balancer based on XDP, open-sourced by Facebook.

name: XDP in practice: integrating XDP in our DDoS mitigation pipeline
description: Protection against DDoS with XDP at Cloudflare.

name: Droplet: DDoS countermeasures powered by BPF + XDP
description: Protection against DDoS with XDP at Facebook.

name: DPDK has a poll-mode driver (PMD) based on AF_XDP
CETH for XDP
description: Common Ethernet Driver Framework for faster network I/O, a technology initiated by Mellanox.

name: relies on eBPF components
description: Extreme Performance Tuning guide - Mark II.

name: "eBPF and XDP" section of Suricata documentation
SEPTun-Mark-II
description: Extreme Performance Tuning guide - Mark II.

name: A blog post introducing the feature
The adventures of a Suricate in eBPF land
eBPF and XDP seen from the eyes of a meerkat
Project Calico
description: Calico is an open source networking and network security solution for containers, virtual machines, and native host-based workloads. Calico's eBPF data plane delivers a low latency, high throughput data plane with a rich network security policy model.

name: Enabling eBPF data plane with Calico
merbridge
description: Use eBPF to speed up your Service Mesh. Merbridge replaces iptables rules with eBPF to intercept traffic. It also combines msg_redirect to reduce latency with a shortened datapath between sidecars and services.

name: InKeV: In-Kernel Distributed Network Virtualization for DCN
DEEP-mon
description: Helps with measuring power consumption for servers and uses eBPF programs for in-kernel aggregation of data.

name: pixie
description: Observability for Kubernetes using eBPF. Features include protocol tracing, application profiling, and support for distributed bpftrace deployments.

name: SkyWalking Rover
description: Apache SkyWalking is an open-source Application Performance Monitoring (APM) platform specially designed for distributed systems with microservices, cloud-native and container-based (Kubernetes) architectures. SkyWalking Rover is an eBPF-based profiler and metrics collector for C, C++, Golang, and Rust applications.

name: parca-agent
description: eBPF based always-on continuous profiler for analysis of CPU and memory usage, down to the line number and throughout time.

name: rbperf
description: Sampling profiler and tracer for Ruby.

name: Hubble
description: Network, service and security observability for Kubernetes using eBPF.

name: Caretta
description: Instant Kubernetes service dependency map generated by eBPF, right to a Grafana instance.

name: Falco
description: A cloud-native runtime security project used as a Kubernetes threat detection engine.

name: Sysmon for Linux
description: A security monitoring tool. It depends on SysinternalsEBPF.

name: Red Canary Linux Agent
description: Red Canary has started to incorporate eBPF to their Linux security sensor.

name: Tracee
description: A runtime security and forensics tool for Linux which uses eBPF technology to trace the system and applications at runtime, and analyze collected events to detect suspicious behavioral patterns.

name: redcanary-ebpf-sensor
description: A set of BPF programs that gather security relevant event data from the Linux kernel. The BPF programs are combined into a single ELF file from which individual probes can be selectively loaded, depending on the running operating system and kernel version.

name: bpflock - Lock Linux machines
description: Lock Linux machines - An eBPF driven security tool for locking and auditing Linux machines.

name: Tetragon
description: Kubernetes-aware, eBPF-based security observability and runtime enforcement.

name: ply
description: A small but flexible open source dynamic tracer for Linux, with features similar to the bcc tools, but with a simpler language inspired by awk and DTrace.

name: bpftrace
description: A tool for tracing with its own high-level tracing language. It is flexible enough to be envisioned as a Linux replacement for DTrace and SystemTap.

name: bpftrace Cheat Sheet
description: Summary and cheat sheet for programming in bpftrace. Contains information about syntax, probe types, variables and functions.

name: kubectl trace
description: A kubectl plug-in for executing bpftrace programs in a Kubernetes cluster.

name: inspektor-gadget
description: A collection of eBPF-based tools to debug and inspect Kubernetes resources and applications.

name: bpfd
description: Framework for running BPF programs with rules on Linux as a daemon. Container aware.

name: BPFd
description: A distinct BPF daemon, trying to leverage the flexibility of the bcc tools to trace and debug remote targets, and in particular devices running with Android.

name: adeb
description: A Linux shell environment for using tracing tools on Android with BPFd.

name: greggd
description: System daemon to compile and load eBPF programs into the kernel, and forward program output to socket for metric aggregation.

name: FUSE
description: Considers using eBPF.

name: upf-bpf
description: An in-kernel solution based on XDP for 5G UPF.

name: redbpf
description: Tooling and framework to write eBPF code in Rust efficiently.

name: ebpf-explorer
description: A web interface to explore system's maps and programs.

name: ebpfmon
description: A TUI (terminal user interface) application for real time monitoring of eBPF programs.

name: Embrace The Red: Offensive BPF!
description: A series of posts around the introduction into BPF with a focus to an offensive setting, and also how its misuse can be detected. Posts include discussions on the rootkit capabilities of eBPF, or on which tracing type is needed for different use cases.

name: eBPF: Block Linux Fileless Payload "Malware" Execution with BPF LSM
description: Blog post about how BPF can help detection and blocking fileless malware.

name: Blackhat 2021: With Friends Like eBPF, Who Needs Enemies?
description: Talk about an eBPF rootkit and how the capabilities of eBPF could be abused. The rootkit was also the object of a talk at Defcon, eBPF, I thought we were friends !.

name: ebpfkit
description: A rootkit that leverages multiple eBPF features to implement offensive security techniques.

name: ebpfkit-monitor
description: An utility to statically analyze eBPF bytecode or monitor suspicious eBPF activity at runtime. It was specifically designed to detect ebpfkit.

name: Bad BPF
description: A collection of malicious eBPF programs that make use of eBPF's ability to read and write user data in between the usermode program and the kernel.

name: TripleCross
description: A Linux eBPF rootkit with a backdoor, C2, library injection, execution hijacking, persistence and stealth capabilities.

name: linux/include/linux/bpf.h
description: with linux/include/uapi/bpf.h: definitions related to eBPF, to be used respectively in the kernel and to interface with userspace programs.

name: linux/include/linux/filter.h
description: with linux/include/uapi/filter.h: information used to run the BPF programs themselves.

name: linux/kernel/bpf/
description: This directory contains most of BPF-related code. In particular, those files are worth of interest:

name: syscall.c
description: Different operations permitted by the system call, such as program loading or map management.

name: core.c
description: BPF interpreter.

name: verifier.c
description: BPF verifier.

name: linux/net/core/filter.c
description: Functions and eBPF helpers related to networking (TC, XDP etc.); also contains the code to migrate cBPF bytecode to eBPF (all cBPF programs are translated to eBPF in recent kernels).

name: linux/kernel/trace/bpf_trace.c
description: Functions and eBPF helpers related to tracing and monitoring (kprobes, tracepoints, etc.).

name: linux/net/sched/
description: and in particular in files act_bpf.c (action) and cls_bpf.c (filter): code related to BPF actions and filters with TC.

name: linux/net/core/dev.c
description: contains the function dev_change_xdp_fd() that is called through a Netlink command to hook a XDP program to a device, after is has been loaded into the kernel from user space. This function in turns uses a callback from the relevant driver.

name: The bpf-next tree
description: BPF patches land in this tree. It is regularly merged into net-next, which is itself merged for each release to Linus' tree.

name: Kernel documentation
description: About contributions to BPF.

name: The netdev mailing list
description: Mailing list for Linux kernel networking stack development. All patches are sent there for review and inclusion.

name: XDP-newbies
description: A mailing list specially dedicated to XDP programming (both for architecture or for asking for help).

name: IO Visor mailing list
description: BPF is at the heart of the project, and is regularly discussed on the mailing list.

name: The XDP Collaboration Project
description: A GitHub repository with notes and ideas regarding the future evolutions of XDP.

name: Dive into BPF: A List of Reading Material
